questions_easy.question:
What should a strong password include?
A. Your birthday
B. Only lowercase letters
C. A mix of letters, numbers, and symbols
D. Your pet’s name
You should never share your password with anyone, not even your best friend.

What is malware?
A. A new software update
B. A game for kids
C. A type of software designed to harm your device or steal information
D. A safe file you download from school

Which one is a sign of a phishing email?
A. Your name is spelled correctly
B. Professional grammar
C. Urgent request for your password
D. Email from your contact list
It is okay to click pop-up ads if they say you won a prize.

What confirms that a website is secure?
A. Red warning sign
B. Lock icon and 'https' in address bar
C. A colorful background
D. Long website name

Which of the following is a good internet safety practice?
A. Using the same password everywhere
B. Posting your location online
C. Ignoring updates
D. Enabling two-factor authentication
Cyberbullying is not a serious issue and can be ignored.

Which device setting helps protect your data if your phone is lost?
A. Bluetooth
B. Airplane mode
C. Screen lock/password
D. Brightness control
It's safe to install apps from any website you find online.

How can you protect your passwords?
A. Share them with close friends
B. Write them on paper
C. Use a password manager
D. Use simple passwords you can remember

Phishing usually tries to:
A. Help fix your device
B. Offer fun videos
C. Trick you into giving personal info
D. Improve your system speed
You should click on links in emails even if you don’t recognize the sender.

Where should you install apps from?
A. Random websites
B. Social media
C. Trusted sources like Google Play or Apple App Store
D. Pop-up ads

Which of the following passwords is strongest?
A. john123
B. Password1
C. Jk#7x@Pz!2lq
D. 123456
Sharing your daily routine on social media is safe.

What should you do if you receive a threatening message online?
A. Reply to the person
B. Share it with friends
C. Ignore and delete it
D. Save evidence and report it

A good example of netiquette is:
A. Using ALL CAPS to make your point
B. Posting without thinking
C. Respecting others’ opinions online
D. Oversharing your location
You should always think before you post something online.

What does 2FA stand for?
A. Two-Face Authentication
B. Two-Factor Authentication
C. Two-Fire Access
D. Second-Firewall Access

questions_normal.question:
What is one way to protect your social media accounts?
A. Share your login with your friends
B. Leave your profile public
C. Enable two-factor authentication
D. Post your address
You should accept all friend requests to grow your followers.

If someone sends threatening messages online, what is that called?
A. Pranking
B. Cyberbullying
C. Spam messaging
D. Online debate

Which is the safest way to connect to public Wi-Fi?
A. Use a VPN
B. Share files while connected
C. Log in to your bank account
D. Disable your firewall
You should ignore app permission requests and allow all of them.

Which of the following might be a scam?
A. Job offer requiring an upfront fee
B. Email from your university with your name
C. Password reset request you made
D. Friend sending a funny meme
Never download attachments from unknown senders.

What does the padlock icon in the address bar usually mean?
A. Site is under maintenance
B. Site is verified and encrypted
C. You need a subscription
D. Site is not safe
It’s okay to share personal details in a private group chat.

Using fake identities or impersonating others online is considered a form of:
A. Entertainment
B. Fraud
C. Free speech
D. Privacy

What should you do before downloading any app?
A. Make sure it's trending
B. Ask a friend
C. Read reviews and check permissions
D. Install it immediately

Which type of information should you avoid sharing on social media?
A. Favorite movies
B. Daily routines and location
C. Funny memes
D. Public news articles
All messages that look official are always trustworthy.

What should you do if an app asks for unnecessary permissions?
A. Allow it anyway
B. Ignore it
C. Deny permissions or uninstall it
D. Share it with friends

Which of the following is an example of a phishing tactic?
A. Asking for feedback
B. A message that says 'Click here to reset your password now!'
C. Birthday greetings
D. Funny meme videos
Enabling privacy settings on social media can help protect your personal information.

Why should you limit personal info in your social media bio?
A. To be mysterious
B. For better SEO
C. To prevent identity theft and scams
D. To save space

Which of the following can be a red flag in a message?
A. Friendly tone
B. Urgent requests for personal info
C. Proper grammar
D. Known sender name
Private messages can still be screenshotted and shared by others.

What’s a smart thing to do if you're unsure about an online message or email?
A. Respond quickly
B. Share with friends
C. Verify it through official sources
D. Delete your account

questions_hard.question:
What is the main purpose of ransomware?
A. Create memes
B. Lock your data until payment is made
C. Speed up your computer
D. Clean your system
All HTTPS websites are guaranteed to be safe.

A __________ attack tricks users into revealing sensitive information through fake websites or messages.
A. Malware
B. DDoS
C. Phishing
D. Spoofing

Which of the following is NOT a safe practice?
A. Using a password manager
B. Keeping software updated
C. Using public Wi-Fi to access banking
D. Enabling 2FA
Antivirus software alone is enough to fully protect your system.

A hacker can gain access to your device by exploiting system __________.
A. Features
B. Updates
C. Vulnerabilities
D. Downloads

Which of the following is a type of social engineering?
A. Firewall
B. Phishing
C. VPN
D. Encryption
Keeping your operating system and software updated helps prevent security breaches.

What is the role of a firewall?
A. Display ads
B. Speed up gaming
C. Block unauthorized access
D. Store backups

Before entering login credentials, verify that the website URL is __________.
A. Short
B. Secure
C. Correct
D. Ending in '.org'

What is the main risk of using the same password across multiple sites?
A. It's easy to remember
B. You'll get locked out
C. One breach can expose all your accounts
D. Slower login speed

A zero-day vulnerability is:
A. An outdated software bug
B. A known bug with a patch
C. An unknown flaw exploited before a fix is available
D. A type of ransomware

Multi-factor authentication (MFA) includes:
A. Password + Username
B. Password + Captcha
C. Password + Additional form of verification
D. Two passwords

Which kind of malware locks you out of your files until a ransom is paid?
A. Spyware
B. Trojan
C. Adware
D. Ransomware

The dark web is accessible using:
A. Chrome
B. VPN
C. Incognito Mode
D. Special browsers like Tor

Clicking suspicious links can install:
A. Fun apps
B. Secure plugins
C. Malware or spyware
D. Antivirus updates

Which of the following is true about spyware?
A. It protects your files
B. It boosts performance
C. It secretly collects your information
D. It helps clean your device

A phishing email might pretend to be from:
A. Your school or bank
B. A music artist
C. A game developer
D. A celebrity fan club
Using outdated antivirus software is just as good as using the latest version.

What should you do if you receive a suspicious message asking for money?
A. Send a small amount first
B. Ask a friend to check it
C. Report it and do not respond
D. Try to call the number
